Thank you for downloading and using MINDdroid Application for Android with your LEGO MINDSTORMS robots!

MINDdroid is an Android Application for the real-time direct action remote control of LEGO MINDSTORMS NXT robots utilizing direct BlueTooth wireless connection between both devices - Android phone and your NXT robot and built-in accelerometer and tilt sensors found on most Android powered hand-held phones and devices.\n No computer or programming needed. Just make sure that your NXT intelligent brick is on and has BlueTooth on and is paired to your hand-held device or a phone beforehand. In the menu the middle button enables you to connect to your NXT robot model. It takes about 2-3 seconds to connect. And it takes 2 to tango...

It interacts in a real-time with NXT robot models built to drive and shoot or drive and throw or drive and hit or just drive using ports B (left) and C (right) for driving motors. By tilting your mobile device down it moves forward. Tilting it up makes your NXT robot model move in the opposite direction or backwards.

Twisting your hand to the left, it will make it turn left and twist right - turn right. It has an Action button that triggers instant 180° turn and back motor action connected to the port A on NXT intelligent brick. It just works with the default and easy to build model Shooter-Bot or any other Tribot.
It will not work with walker robot models like our famed AlphaRex.

It indicates the direction you are tilting your hand-held device to and the direction your NXT robot moves. Short haptic feedback indicates that you just started driving around. Having your phone flat on your palm will make NXT robot stop and you can stare into the NXT logo. The more you tilt, faster the robot moves and faster the square blinks. Cool, huh?

Because we can. And we think it is fun. Moreover, it will inspire you and many others to start building cool Applications for interacting with NXT and Android devices and even more cool LEGO MINDSTORMS robots. Because you can.\n\nNow go, try it out, have fun, play good and do not forget to visit us at http://mindstorms.com for more news, info and upcoming appies and goodies.
